TextView.android:text: It can be really overwhelming when it comes to trying to understand this movement. There is a lot of information to read about and so much to learn about that it can be confusing on how one can help make a difference. If you are here reading and looking for ways to help out you have already taken the first step of helping out. Being educated on this matter is highly important before you can go out and make change. Now that you have a decent understanding of what this movement is about there are a few other steps you can take that would really help make an impact on the world.

The 4 key things that any person can do to help is to donate, sign petitions, show up to protests, and vote if you are old enough to. If you are able to do one or any or all of these things it will be greatly appreciated by everyone and it will help make a truly lasting change in our country. It is time we see real change for all of these movements and down below is how you can do your part. It is also important to just reach out and check in on friends and family. Share your resources and have the difficult conversations with the more close minded people of our societies. Be an ally in any way possible because staying silent only adds to the oppressions that have already been going on for too long.

Donating is a crucial part of this movement because there are already many organizations that do incredible work and you can help them continue doing all the amazing things they have done so far. Aside from donating money you can also donate your time to these organizations who are always looking for volunteers to help them out.
The Trevor Project is a non-profit that focuses on suicide prevention within the LGBTQ+ community - \nhttps://www.thetrevorproject.org/
Point Foundation provides financial aid to members of the LGBTQ+ community struggling to pay for college - \nhttps://pointfoundation.org/
National Center for Transgender Equality is the leading advocacy group for transgender people. They provide many resources from legal help to family support. - https://transequality.org/
GLSEN is a national education organization targeted to make K-12 schools a safe environment for LGBTQ+ students - https://www.glsen.org/
It Gets Better is a non-profit organization dedicated to empowering LGBTQ+ youth around the world -\nhttps://itgetsbetter.org/

Here are two websites full of many petitions to push forward change for the lgbtq+ community. It will only take a few clicks to help make a big difference in many people’s lives. Please help push forward the change!\nhttps://www.thepetitionsite.com/lgbtq-rights/#hottest\nhttps://www.change.org/t/lgbt-rights-3

When it comes to the LGBTQ+ community protests are an important part of their history. The reason these individuals have gained so many rights is because they were not afraid to stand up to their oppressors and fight for what they deserved. The pride parade which we celebrate till date began as a riot and has now become a celebration but we must never forget its roots and where it all began. LGBTQ+ people are considered a minority and just like any other minority or race, gender, or class they need all the help they can get to help keep the change moving forward. We urge you to go to your local pride parades and protests to stand in solidarity with this community and display to them that you are truly an ally. Just saying your not homophobic or transphobic isn’t enough it is time to be active ally’s and support people that need your help.

The power to vote is not something that should be taken lightly. It gives one more power than he or she realizes to help create real change. Voting for bills and local community leaders is a great way to support the LGBTQ+ community. Vote for officials who are supportive of the community and are willing to pass laws to create equal rights for them. Vote for bills that actively try to stop discrimnation in any way against these individuals. At a local level you need to do your own research and use the power you have by voting for bills in favor of the LGBTQ+ community. Many states are actively passing bills against LGBTQ+ people and many don’t realize because they do not publicize it. While the LGBTQ+ community is being more accepted socially they need to be treated equally under the law as well and it is time to help them out by simply using a power you have already been given by this country.
